author: rhuijben
msg: Take a few small steps towards removing access batons and entries
This patch removes several arguments that can be recalculated now and
are not necessary any more after the refactoring. It also prepares
svn_client_status5() for receiving absolute paths from libsvn_wc without
(tweak_status): Make the status return relative paths if the user
(svn_client_status5): If the passed path is relative store it in the
status baton to allow making returned paths relative.
(edit_baton, dir_baton, file_baton): Add absolute path variables.
Update arguments to receive the edit baton and absolute path instead of
an access baton and several separate values. Temporarily recalculate the
(is_external_path): Receive edit_baton and ensure passed paths are absolute.
(send_unversioned_item): Receive edit baton and absolute path instead of 4
separate arguments. Temporarily recalculate the relative path.
(get_dir_status): Store absolute paths to externals and update calls.
(make_dir_baton): Store local_abspath in baton and don't duplicate values
that live longer than this editor
(svn_wc_get_status_editor5): Store abspath for target and anchor.

author: rhuijben
msg: Following up on r39080, fix the obvious deprecated svn_path_*()
calls in libsvn_fs, libsvn_fs_base and libsvn_fs_fs.
Use svn_dirent_*() for local paths, and svn_uri_*() for repository

author: hwright
msg: Use the new node-walking function to replace a couple of calls to
svn_wc_walk_entries3() when setting changelists.  Also, add a helper
function to determine if a path is in a changelist.
Rename several variables, remove the access baton, and use the new node

author: neels
msg: Add two tests, related to tree-conflicts during replace,
